intro: Centaurea elymaitica, commonly known as the Elymaian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Centaurea elymaitica has a compact growth habit and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its hardy nature makes it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
